comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When the find bar is active at the bottom of the screen, things that would normally show up, like when you hover the mouse cursor over a url, are hidden.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open firefox
2.  Go to google.com
3.  Hover over one of the links and see the url for it at the bottom right pop up
4.  Press ctrl+f
5.  Hover over the same link and you can't see the url anymore pop up
Actual Results:  
Url can't be seen

Expected Results:  
Url pop up should be able to be seen on top of the find bar at the bottom.  Firefox 3 didn't have this issue because it had a status bar which showed this kind of information and the find bar showed up on top of that so it wasn't over it.
comments.creator: carl@purpleglobe.com

comments.raw_text: I doesn't do that for me. When the find bar is displayed, the url popup is displayed at the right. The reason why it moves to the right is indeed bug 631270, but it helps in this case too.
